episodeTitle: Iron Pirate! Here Comes General Franky!
description: During the battle at Gyoncorde Plaza, Daruma attacks the Brachio Tank V by collapsing the ground beneath it. Franky reveals his new trump card by combining his vehicles into General Franky, a giant mecha. Meanwhile, Luffy discovers Hody has been blackmailing Surume by threatening his brothers, leading Luffy to promise protection. After Surume releases Shirahoshi, Luffy uses Gear Second to confront Hody. The episode ends with the massive ship Noah appearing on a collision course with Fish-Man Island.

events.title: Daruma Attacks Brachio Tank V
events.description: Daruma uses his Cookie Cutter ability to burrow underground and create tunnels beneath Gyoncorde Plaza. He then uses his Daruma Drop technique to collapse the ground underneath Franky's Brachio Tank V, creating a large pitfall.
events.significance: This attack sets the stage for Franky to reveal his ultimate weapon, General Franky, as a countermeasure.

events.title: General Franky Debut
events.description: Franky reveals his new ultimate weapon by having the Kurosai FR-U IV dock with the Brachio Tank V, forming a giant 13-meter tall mecha called General Franky (BF-38). The transformation impresses Luffy, Usopp, and Chopper immensely.
events.significance: Marks the debut of Franky's most powerful post-timeskip creation, showcasing his growth as a shipwright and combatant. This is one of Franky's signature abilities going forward.

quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky announces the formation of his giant mecha

events.title: Nami Uses Gust Sword
events.description: Nami demonstrates her new technique, Gust Sword, using her upgraded Clima-Tact to create powerful wind-based attacks against the New Fishman Pirates.
events.significance: Shows Nami's growth in combat ability after the timeskip with enhanced weather manipulation techniques.

events.title: Usopp's Midori Boshi: Take Jave-rin
events.description: Usopp showcases a new Pop Green technique, firing bamboo spears at the enemy forces to support his crew in battle.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's post-timeskip arsenal utilizing the Pop Greens he cultivated on Boin Archipelago.

events.title: Hody's Blackmail of Surume Revealed
events.description: Luffy overhears Hody Jones threatening Surume the Kraken, revealing that Hody has been blackmailing Surume by holding his brothers captive in the North Pole and threatening to kill them if Surume doesn't obey orders.
events.significance: This revelation explains Surume's hostile actions and sets up Luffy's intervention. It demonstrates Hody's ruthless methods and gives insight into how he maintains control.

quotes.text: If you continue to disobey, I'll go to the North Pole and kill your brothers!
quotes.speaker: Hody Jones
quotes.context: Hody threatens Surume to maintain control

events.title: Luffy Promises to Protect Surume's Brothers
events.description: After hearing about Hody's blackmail, Luffy immediately promises Surume that he will protect his brothers, freeing Surume from Hody's control and earning the Kraken's loyalty.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's character - his willingness to protect others and make bold promises. This moment turns Surume from an enemy into an ally and shows Luffy's natural ability to gain followers.

quotes.text: Don't worry! I'll protect your brothers!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's promise that frees Surume from Hody's control

events.title: Luffy Uses Gear Second
events.description: Luffy activates Gear Second to bypass the New Fishman Pirates officers and quickly reach Hody Jones, demonstrating his enhanced speed.
events.significance: Shows that Luffy has refined his Gear Second technique post-timeskip, now able to activate it more efficiently for strategic movement in battle.

events.title: Surume Releases Shirahoshi
events.description: Freed from Hody's blackmail by Luffy's promise, Surume releases Princess Shirahoshi from his grasp, allowing her to escape danger.
events.significance: Marks a turning point in the battle as Shirahoshi is freed and Surume switches allegiance from Hody to Luffy.

events.title: Luffy Confronts Hody Jones
events.description: Luffy successfully reaches Hody Jones, setting up their direct confrontation as the climax of the Fish-Man Island conflict approaches.
events.significance: Represents the beginning of the final showdown between Luffy and the main antagonist of the Fish-Man Island arc.

events.title: Noah Appears on Collision Course
events.description: The massive ancient ship Noah suddenly appears in the sky above Fish-Man Island, descending on a direct collision course with the island. This ancient vessel is connected to Joy Boy's promise and could destroy the entire island upon impact.
events.significance: Introduces a major threat that escalates the conflict beyond just defeating Hody. The Noah is tied to ancient history, Joy Boy's broken promise, and Shirahoshi's identity as the ancient weapon Poseidon. This sets up one of the arc's climactic moments.

quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky announces the formation of his giant mecha

quotes.text: If you continue to disobey, I'll go to the North Pole and kill your brothers!
quotes.speaker: Hody Jones
quotes.context: Hody threatens Surume to maintain control

quotes.text: Don't worry! I'll protect your brothers!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's promise that frees Surume from Hody's control

themes.description: The episode explores themes of blackmail and coercion through Hody's control of Surume, contrasted with Luffy's liberation of the Kraken through a promise of protection rather than threats.
themes.symbolism: Surume's release of Shirahoshi symbolizes breaking free from tyrannical control when given hope and support.

themes.description: Franky's debut of General Franky showcases the fruits of his two-year training with Dr. Vegapunk's technology, representing progress and adaptation.
themes.symbolism: General Franky represents the merging of traditional pirate spirit with advanced technology, embodying Franky's philosophy of being 'SUPER' through constant improvement.
culturalReferences: The mecha design draws from classic Japanese super robot anime traditions

themes.description: The appearance of Noah ties into the ancient history of Fish-Man Island, Joy Boy's promise, and the looming prophecy about the island's destruction.
themes.symbolism: Noah represents both hope (as the ship meant to bring fish-men to the surface) and potential destruction (as it threatens to crush the island).
culturalReferences: Biblical reference to Noah's Ark as a vessel of salvation

characterSpotlights.development: Franky reveals the culmination of his two years of training and research, showing off his ultimate creation that combines his vehicles into a powerful battle mecha.
keyActions: Combines Kurosai FR-U IV with Brachio Tank V

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his characteristic compassion and willingness to help those in need, even in the midst of battle, by promising to protect Surume's family.
keyActions: Uses Gear Second to reach Hody
quotes: Don't worry! I'll protect your brothers!

characterSpotlights.development: Hody's cruel methods are further exposed through his blackmail of Surume, showing his willingness to use hostages and threats to achieve his goals.
keyActions: Attempts to maintain control through fear
quotes: If you continue to disobey, I'll go to the North Pole and kill your brothers!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends some battle sequences and reaction shots to General Franky's debut, particularly Luffy, Usopp, and Chopper's excitement.

trivia.fact: General Franky stands at 13 meters (42'7") tall, making it several times the size of an average person but still smaller than Chopper's Monster Point.

sources.title: Battle Frankies/General Franky - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This episode adapts content from Chapter 636 (pages 3-19) of the One Piece manga.
The episode aired one day earlier in the US via simulcast (July 28, 2012) than it did in Japan (July 29, 2012) due to time zone differences.
General Franky is designated as BF-38 in the Battle Franky line, with BF standing for 'Battle Franky'.
